info.title: REST API
info.description: The REST API is used for all API interactions with DataCite services.

get.summary: Get a JSON API result of activities.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Find activity by an ID.

parameters.name: ids
parameters.description: Find activities by array of activity IDs.

parameters.name: query
parameters.description: Search the index by keyword or query string syntax.

parameters.name: page[number]
parameters.description: Page number for [pagination](https://support.datacite.org/docs/pagination).

parameters.name: page[size]
parameters.description: Page size between 0 and 1,000 for [pagination](https://support.datacite.org/docs/pagination).

parameters.name: page[cursor]
parameters.description: Use for [cursor-based pagination](https://support.datacite.org/docs/pagination#method-2-cursor).

200.description: A JSON API result of activities.

items.description: Represents an activity for an event within DataCite systems.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Activity ID.

get.summary: Get a JSON API result of a specific activity.

data.description: Represents an activity for an event within DataCite systems.

parameters.name: client-id
parameters.description: Filter by a specific DataCite client (repository). Use commas to include multiple repositories.

parameters.name: page[number]
parameters.description: Page number for [pagination](https://support.datacite.org/docs/pagination).

parameters.name: page[size]
parameters.description: Page size between 0 and 1,000 for [pagination](https://support.datacite.org/docs/pagination).

parameters.name: year
parameters.description: The year the client was created.

parameters.name: provider-id
parameters.description: Filter by a specific DataCite provider (Direct Member or Consortium Organization). Use commas to include multiple providers.

parameters.name: page[number]
parameters.description: Page number for [pagination](https://support.datacite.org/docs/pagination).

parameters.name: page[size]
parameters.description: Page size between 0 and 1,000 for [pagination](https://support.datacite.org/docs/pagination).

contactEmail.description: Returned only when authenticated with associated credentials.

hasPassword.description: Returned only when authenticated with associated credentials.

consortium.description: Returned only when the client is associated with a Consortium.

parameters.name: provider-id
parameters.description: Filter by a specific DataCite provider (Direct Member or Consortium Organization). Use commas to include multiple providers.

parameters.name: state
parameters.description: Authentication is required to retrieve draft records.

200.description: A JSON array of clients stats.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: DataCite Repository account ID.

contactEmail.description: Returned only when authenticated with associated credentials.

hasPassword.description: Returned only when authenticated with associated credentials.

consortium.description: Returned only when the client is associated with a Consortium.

symbol.description: Can only contain capital letters, numbers, and at most one hyphen. Must begin with provider ID followed by a period ("."). Minimum length is 5 characters and maximum length is 18 characters.

issn.description: Will only be saved if the repository has clientType "periodical".

isActive.description: Set to true if this account can register and update DOIs.

passwordInput.description: Sets the password of the repository account.

id.description: The symbol of the provider (DataCite Member or Consortium Organization) the repository belongs to.

systemEmail.description: Returned only when authenticated with associated credentials.

serviceContact.description: Returned only when authenticated with associated credentials.

hasPassword.description: Returned only when authenticated with associated credentials.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: DataCite Repository ID.

issn.description: Will only be saved if the repository has clientType "periodical".

isActive.description: Set to true if this account can register and update DOIs.

passwordInput.description: Sets the password of the repository account.

systemEmail.description: Returned only when authenticated with associated credentials.

serviceContact.description: Returned only when authenticated with associated credentials.

hasPassword.description: Returned only when authenticated with associated credentials.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: DataCite Repository ID.

delete.summary: Delete a repository (only possible if no DOIs are in the repository)

parameters.name: query
parameters.description: Search [DOI metadata fields](https://support.datacite.org/docs/api-queries#using-the-query-parameter) using OpenSearch query string syntax.

parameters.name: created
parameters.description: Filter by the DOI date created (yyyy). Use commas to filter by multiple years (yyyy,yyyy).

parameters.name: registered
parameters.description: Filter by the DOI date registered (yyyy). Use commas to filter by multiple years (yyyy,yyyy).

parameters.name: published
parameters.description: Filter by the DOI date published (yyyy). Use commas to filter by multiple years (yyyy,yyyy).

parameters.name: provider-id
parameters.description: Filter by a specific DataCite provider (Direct Member or Consortium Organization). Use commas to include multiple providers.

parameters.name: client-id
parameters.description: Filter by a specific DataCite client (repository). Use commas to include multiple repositories.

parameters.name: consortium-id
parameters.description: Filter by a specific DataCite consortium.

parameters.name: prefix
parameters.description: Filter by a specific prefix. Use commmas to include multiple prefixes.

parameters.name: affiliation-id
parameters.description: Search creators.affiliation.affiliationIdentifier and contributors.affiliation.affiliationIdentifier for a ROR ID.

parameters.name: funder-id
parameters.description: Search fundingReferences.funderIdentifier for a Crossref Funder ID.

parameters.name: user-id
parameters.description: Search creators.nameIdentifiers.nameIdentifier for an ORCID iD.

parameters.name: resource-type-id
parameters.description: Filter by the resourceTypeGeneral. Use commmas to include multiple values.

parameters.name: resource-type
parameters.description: Filter by the free text resourceType. Use commmas to include multiple values.

parameters.name: subject
parameters.description: Filter by the free text Subject. Use commmas to include multiple terms.

parameters.name: state
parameters.description: Filter by the [DOI state](https://support.datacite.org/docs/doi-states). Authentication is required to retrieve registered DOIs and draft records.

parameters.name: affiliation
parameters.description: Set `affiliation=true` to see additional affiliation information such as the affiliation identifier.

parameters.name: publisher
parameters.description: Set `publisher=true` to see additional publisher information such as the publisher identifier.

parameters.name: has-citations
parameters.description: Search the citationCount field for integer values greater than or equal to the inputted value.

parameters.name: has-references
parameters.description: Search the referenceCount field for integer values greater than or equal to the inputted value.

parameters.name: has-parts
parameters.description: Search the partCount field for integer values greater than or equal to the inputted value.

parameters.name: has-part-of
parameters.description: Search the partOfCount field for integer values greater than or equal to the inputted value.

parameters.name: has-versions
parameters.description: Search the versionCount field for integer values greater than or equal to the inputted value.

parameters.name: has-version-of
parameters.description: Search the versionOfCount field for integer values greater than or equal to the inputted value.

parameters.name: has-views
parameters.description: Search the viewCount field for integer values greater than or equal to the inputted value.

parameters.name: has-downloads
parameters.description: Search the downloadCount field for integer values greater than or equal to the inputted value.

parameters.name: has-person
parameters.description: Return DOIs where creators.nameIdentifiers.nameIdentifierScheme has at least one "ORCID" value.

parameters.name: has-affiliation
parameters.description: Return DOIs where either creators.affiliation.affiliationIdentifierScheme or contributors.affiliation.affiliationIdentifierScheme has at least one "ROR" value.

parameters.name: has-organization
parameters.description: Return DOIs where either creators.nameIdentifiers.nameIdentifierScheme or contributors.nameIdentifiers.nameIdentifierScheme has at least one "ROR" value.

parameters.name: has-funder
parameters.description: Return DOIs where fundingReferences.funderIdentifierType has at least one "Crossref Funder ID" value.

parameters.name: random
parameters.description: Retreive a random sample of DOIs. When true, the `page[number]` parameter is ignored.

parameters.name: page[number]
parameters.description: Page number for [pagination](https://support.datacite.org/docs/pagination).

parameters.name: page[size]
parameters.description: Page size between 0 and 1,000 for [pagination](https://support.datacite.org/docs/pagination).

parameters.name: page[cursor]
parameters.description: Use for [cursor-based pagination](https://support.datacite.org/docs/pagination#method-2-cursor).

parameters.name: sort
parameters.description:
Sort order:
 * `relevance` - Relevance score descending 
 * `name` - DOI name alphabetical ascending 
 * `-name` - DOI name alphabetical descending
 * `created` - Created date ascending
 * `-created` - Created date descending
 * `updated` - Updated date ascending
 * `-updated` - Updated date descending
 * `published` - Published date ascending
 * `-published` - Published date descending
 * `view-count` - viewCount ascending
 * `-view-count` - viewCount descending
 * `download-count` - downloadCount ascending
 * `-download-count` - downloadCount descending
 * `citation-count` - citationCount ascending
 * `-citation-count` - citationCount descending
 * `title` - first title alphabetical ascending
 * `-title` - first title alphabetical descending

parameters.name: disable-facets
parameters.description: Exclude facets from the response.

parameters.name: detail
parameters.description:
When set to `true`, will include the following in the response:
 * attributes:
   * `prefix`
   * `suffix`
   * `viewsOverTime`
   * `citationsOverTime`
   * `references`
   * `citations`
   * `parts`
   * `partOf`
   * `versions`
   * `versionOf`
   * `xml`
   * `alternateIdentifiers`
* relationships:
   * `provider`

parameters.name: fields[dois]
parameters.description: Only return the attributes specified. For example, `fields[dois]=titles,subjects` will only return titles and subjects.

parameters.name: source
parameters.description: The [system used to create the DOI](https://support.datacite.org/docs/api-get-doi#source).

schema.description: Represents a list of DOIs and provides access to metadata attributes, further schema specific information can be found at https://schema.datacite.org

affiliation.description: Set `affiliation=true` to see additional affiliation information such as the affiliation identifier.

publisher.description: [DataCite Metadata Schema: Publisher](https://datacite-metadata-schema.readthedocs.io/en/4/properties/publisher/) Set `publisher=true` to see additional publisher information such as the publisher identifier.

affiliation.description: Set `affiliation=true` to see additional affiliation information such as the affiliation identifier.

url.description: The landing page URL of the DOI.

contentUrl.description: An array of content URLs associated with the DOI.

metadataVersion.description: The version of the stored DataCite metadata, incremented once per update.

schemaVersion.description: The DataCite Metadata Schema version of the stored DOI metadata represented as a URL. When creating or updating a DOI, `schemaVersion` is not necessary unless modifying the DataCite Metadata Schema version.

allOf.description: The system used to create the DOI.

isActive.description: "true" if the DOI is in [Findable state](https://support.datacite.org/docs/doi-states#findable-doi-name). Otherwise, "false".

allOf.description: The [state of the DOI](https://support.datacite.org/docs/doi-states).

viewCount.description: Total views, pulled from Event Data.

downloadCount.description: Total downloads, pulled from Event Data.

referenceCount.description: Total references, pulled from Event Data.

citationCount.description: Total citations, pulled from Event Data.

partCount.description: Total number of parts, pulled from Event Data.

partOfCount.description: Total number of parents, pulled from Event Data.

versionCount.description: Total number of versions, pulled from Event Data.

versionOfCount.description: Total number to which this DOI is a version, pulled from Event Data.

created.description: The date the DOI record was created in the DataCite system.

registered.description: The date the DOI was registered in the global handle server.

updated.description: The date the DOI was last updated.

allOf.description: Counts by DOI state.
resourceTypes in the search results with counts.
Histogram of the create date of the DOI record by top 10 years with counts.
Histogram of publicationYear years with counts.
Histogram of the registered date of the DOI record by top 10 years with counts.
The top 10 DataCite Members or Consortium Organizations with account IDs, titles, and counts.
The top 10 repositories in the search results with account IDs, titles, and counts.
The top 10 represented ROR affliations with ROR ID, research organization title, and counts.
The top 10 prefixes in the search with counts.
Repository certificates in the search with counts.
The top 10 rights with rights identifiers in the search with counts.
The DataCite Metadata Schema versions represented in the search with counts.
The status of the landing pages of DOIs in the search (when and if last checked) with counts.
The top 10 subjects represented in the search with counts.
The top 10 Fields of Science and Technology (FOS) subjects in the search with counts.
A histogram of citations by publicationYear in the search by top 10 years with counts.
A histogram of views by publicationYear in the search by top 10 years with counts.
A histogram of downloads by publicationYear in the search by top 10 years with counts.

titles.title: DataCite Metadata Schema Documentation for the Publication and Citation of Research Data v4.1

parameters.name: affiliation
parameters.description: Set `affiliation=true` to see additional affiliation information such as the affiliation identifier.

parameters.name: publisher
parameters.description: Set `publisher=true` to see additional publisher information such as the publisher identifier.

schema.description: Represents a single DOI and provides access to metadata attributes. More information is available at https://schema.datacite.org.

event.description:
Can be set to trigger a [DOI state change](https://support.datacite.org/docs/updating-metadata-with-the-rest-api#changing-the-doi-state). When not set, a [Draft record](https://support.datacite.org/docs/doi-states#draft-record) is created.
  * `publish` - Create a DOI in [Findable state](https://support.datacite.org/docs/doi-states#findable-doi-name) (or change an existing Draft record/Registered DOI to Findable state).
  * `register` - Create a DOI in [Registered state](https://support.datacite.org/docs/doi-states#registered-doi-name) (or change an existing Draft record to Registered state).
  * `hide` - Change a DOI from Findable to Registered state.

identifiers.description: Equivalent to the [AlternateIdentifier](https://datacite-metadata-schema.readthedocs.io/en/4/properties/alternateidentifier/) property in the DataCite Metadata Schema. For more information, see [What is the "identifiers" attribute in the REST API?](https://support.datacite.org/docs/what-is-the-identifiers-attribute-in-the-rest-api)

affiliation.description: Set `affiliation=true` to see additional affiliation information such as the affiliation identifier.

publisher.description: [DataCite Metadata Schema: Publisher](https://datacite-metadata-schema.readthedocs.io/en/4/properties/publisher/) Set `publisher=true` to see additional publisher information such as the publisher identifier.

affiliation.description: Set `affiliation=true` to see additional affiliation information such as the affiliation identifier.

xml.description: DataCite Metadata Schema XML encoded in Base64 format.

url.description: The landing page URL of the DOI.

contentUrl.description: An array of content URLs associated with the DOI.

metadataVersion.description: The version of the stored DataCite metadata, incremented once per update.

schemaVersion.description: The DataCite Metadata Schema version of the stored DOI metadata represented as a URL. When creating or updating a DOI, `schemaVersion` is not necessary unless modifying the DataCite Metadata Schema version.

allOf.description: The system used to create the DOI.

isActive.description: "true" if the DOI is in [Findable state](https://support.datacite.org/docs/doi-states#findable-doi-name). Otherwise, "false".

allOf.description: The [state of the DOI](https://support.datacite.org/docs/doi-states).

viewCount.description: Total views, pulled from Event Data.

downloadCount.description: Total downloads, pulled from Event Data.

referenceCount.description: Total references, pulled from Event Data.

citationCount.description: Total citations, pulled from Event Data.

partCount.description: Total number of parts, pulled from Event Data.

partOfCount.description: Total number of parents, pulled from Event Data.

versionCount.description: Total number of versions, pulled from Event Data.

versionOfCount.description: Total number to which this DOI is a version, pulled from Event Data.

landingPage.description: Data describing the landing page, used by link checking.

created.description: The date the DOI record was created in the DataCite system.

registered.description: The date the DOI was registered in the global handle server.

updated.description: The date the DOI was last updated.

client.description: The DataCite client (repository) associated with the DOI.

provider.description: The DataCite provider (Direct Member or Consortium Organization) associated with the DOI.

references.description: An array of references as dictionaries.

citations.description: An array of citations as dictionaries.

parts.description: An array of parts as dictionaries.

partOf.description: An array of parents as dictionaries.

versions.description: An array of versions as dictionaries.

versionOf.description: An array of objects to which this DOI is a version as dictionaries.

titles.title: DataCite Metadata Schema Documentation for the Publication and Citation of Research Data v4.1

schema.description: Represents a single DOI and provides access to metadata attributes. More information is available at https://schema.datacite.org.

event.description:
Can be set to trigger a [DOI state change](https://support.datacite.org/docs/updating-metadata-with-the-rest-api#changing-the-doi-state). When not set, a [Draft record](https://support.datacite.org/docs/doi-states#draft-record) is created.
  * `publish` - Create a DOI in [Findable state](https://support.datacite.org/docs/doi-states#findable-doi-name) (or change an existing Draft record/Registered DOI to Findable state).
  * `register` - Create a DOI in [Registered state](https://support.datacite.org/docs/doi-states#registered-doi-name) (or change an existing Draft record to Registered state).
  * `hide` - Change a DOI from Findable to Registered state.

identifiers.description: Equivalent to the [AlternateIdentifier](https://datacite-metadata-schema.readthedocs.io/en/4/properties/alternateidentifier/) property in the DataCite Metadata Schema. For more information, see [What is the "identifiers" attribute in the REST API?](https://support.datacite.org/docs/what-is-the-identifiers-attribute-in-the-rest-api)

affiliation.description: Set `affiliation=true` to see additional affiliation information such as the affiliation identifier.

publisher.description: [DataCite Metadata Schema: Publisher](https://datacite-metadata-schema.readthedocs.io/en/4/properties/publisher/) Set `publisher=true` to see additional publisher information such as the publisher identifier.

affiliation.description: Set `affiliation=true` to see additional affiliation information such as the affiliation identifier.

xml.description: DataCite Metadata Schema XML encoded in Base64 format.

url.description: The landing page URL of the DOI.

contentUrl.description: An array of content URLs associated with the DOI.

metadataVersion.description: The version of the stored DataCite metadata, incremented once per update.

schemaVersion.description: The DataCite Metadata Schema version of the stored DOI metadata represented as a URL. When creating or updating a DOI, `schemaVersion` is not necessary unless modifying the DataCite Metadata Schema version.

allOf.description: The system used to create the DOI.

isActive.description: "true" if the DOI is in [Findable state](https://support.datacite.org/docs/doi-states#findable-doi-name). Otherwise, "false".

allOf.description: The [state of the DOI](https://support.datacite.org/docs/doi-states).

viewCount.description: Total views, pulled from Event Data.

downloadCount.description: Total downloads, pulled from Event Data.

referenceCount.description: Total references, pulled from Event Data.

citationCount.description: Total citations, pulled from Event Data.

partCount.description: Total number of parts, pulled from Event Data.

partOfCount.description: Total number of parents, pulled from Event Data.

versionCount.description: Total number of versions, pulled from Event Data.

versionOfCount.description: Total number to which this DOI is a version, pulled from Event Data.

landingPage.description: Data describing the landing page, used by link checking.

created.description: The date the DOI record was created in the DataCite system.

registered.description: The date the DOI was registered in the global handle server.

updated.description: The date the DOI was last updated.

client.description: The DataCite client (repository) associated with the DOI.

provider.description: The DataCite provider (Direct Member or Consortium Organization) associated with the DOI.

references.description: An array of references as dictionaries.

citations.description: An array of citations as dictionaries.

parts.description: An array of parts as dictionaries.

partOf.description: An array of parents as dictionaries.

versions.description: An array of versions as dictionaries.

versionOf.description: An array of objects to which this DOI is a version as dictionaries.

titles.title: DataCite Metadata Schema Documentation for the Publication and Citation of Research Data v4.1

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: DOI

delete.summary: Delete a DOI (for DOIs in draft state only).

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: DOI

get.summary: Return activities for a specific DOI.

items.description: Represents an activity for an event within DataCite systems.

parameters.name: query
parameters.description: Query for any event information.

parameters.name: subj-id
parameters.description: The identifier for the event subject expressed as URL.

parameters.name: obj-id
parameters.description: The identifier for the event object expressed as URL.

parameters.name: doi
parameters.description: The subj-id or obj-id of the event expressed as DOI.

parameters.name: prefix
parameters.description: The DOI prefix of the subj-id or obj-id of the event.

parameters.name: orcid
parameters.description: The subj-id or obj-id of the event expressed as an ORCID iD.

parameters.name: year-month
parameters.description: The year and month in which the event occurred in the format YYYY-MM.

parameters.name: source-id
parameters.description: The [source of the event](https://support.datacite.org/docs/eventdata-guide#source-id). Use commas to include multiple sources.

parameters.name: relation-type-id
parameters.description: The relation type of the event. See [Linking events](https://support.datacite.org/docs/eventdata-guide#linking-events) and [Usage events](https://support.datacite.org/docs/eventdata-guide#usage-events) documentation for definitions. Use commas to include multiple relation types.

parameters.name: page[number]
parameters.description: Page number for [pagination](https://support.datacite.org/docs/pagination).

parameters.name: page[size]
parameters.description: Page size between 0 and 1,000 for [pagination](https://support.datacite.org/docs/pagination).

parameters.name: page[cursor]
parameters.description: Use for [cursor-based pagination](https://support.datacite.org/docs/pagination#method-2-cursor).

parameters.name: sort
parameters.description: Sort order. By default, all events are sorted in ascending chronological order (using the last updated timestamp).

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Event

get.summary: Return the current status of the REST API.

500.description: REST API is not working properly.

parameters.name: client-id
parameters.description: Filter by a specific DataCite client (repository). Use commas to include multiple repositories.

200.description: A JSON array of prefixes stats.

204.description: No content; must include the client-id parameter.

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Prefix

parameters.name: consortium-id
parameters.description: Filter by a specific DataCite consortium.

parameters.name: provider-id
parameters.description: Filter by a specific DataCite provider (Direct Member or Consortium Organization). Use commas to include multiple providers.

parameters.name: page[number]
parameters.description: Page number for [pagination](https://support.datacite.org/docs/pagination).

parameters.name: page[size]
parameters.description: Page size between 0 and 1,000 for [pagination](https://support.datacite.org/docs/pagination).

get.summary: Return a list of providers (including members and consortium organizations).

parameters.name: year
parameters.description: The year the provider was created.

parameters.name: consortium-id
parameters.description: Filter by a specific DataCite consortium.

parameters.name: page[number]
parameters.description: Page number for [pagination](https://support.datacite.org/docs/pagination).

parameters.name: page[size]
parameters.description: Page size between 0 and 1,000 for [pagination](https://support.datacite.org/docs/pagination).

parameters.name: platform
parameters.description: Name of the Platform the usage is being requested for. This can be omitted if the service provides usage for only one platform.

parameters.name: report-name
parameters.description: The long name of the report.

parameters.name: report-id
parameters.description: The report ID or code or shortname. Typically this will be the same code provided in the Report parameter of the request.

parameters.name: release
parameters.description: The release or version of the report.

parameters.name: created
parameters.description: Time the report was prepared. Format as defined by date-time - RFC3339

parameters.name: created-by
parameters.description: Name of the organization producing the report.

parameters.name: page[number]
parameters.description: Page number for [pagination](https://support.datacite.org/docs/pagination).

parameters.name: page[size]
parameters.description: Page size between 0 and 1,000 for [pagination](https://support.datacite.org/docs/pagination).

items.description: Describes the formatting needs for the COUNTER Dataset Report. Response may include the Report_Header (optional), Report_Datasets (usage stats).

report-name.description: The long name of the report.

report-id.description: The report ID or code or shortname. Typically this will be the same code provided in the Report parameter of the request.

release.description: The release or version of the report.

created-by.description: Name of the organization producing the report.

created.description: Time the report was prepared. Format as defined by date-time - RFC3339

report-filters.description: Zero or more report filters used for this report. Typically reflect filters provided on the Request. Filters limit the data to be reported on.

report-attributes.description: Zero or more additional attributes applied to the report. Attributes inform the level of detail in the report.

report-datasets.description: Defines the output for the Report_Datasets being returned in a Dataset Report. Collection of datasets from the report.

yop.description: Year of publication in the format of 'yyyy'. Use '0001' for unknown and '9999' for articles in press.

data-type.description: Nature of the dataset being reported.

publisher.description: Name of publisher of the dataset.

dataset-id.description: The identifier for the report dataset.

access-method.description: Identifies if the usage activity was 'Regular' usage - a user doing research on a content site, or if the usage activity was 'Machine' - for the purpose of retrieving content for Text and Data Mining (TDM).

dataset-title.description: Name of the dataset being reported.

dataset-contributors.description: The identifier for contributor (i.e. creator) of the dataset.

DoiDetailItem.description: Represents a single DOI and provides access to metadata attributes. More information is available at https://schema.datacite.org.

event.description:
Can be set to trigger a [DOI state change](https://support.datacite.org/docs/updating-metadata-with-the-rest-api#changing-the-doi-state). When not set, a [Draft record](https://support.datacite.org/docs/doi-states#draft-record) is created.
  * `publish` - Create a DOI in [Findable state](https://support.datacite.org/docs/doi-states#findable-doi-name) (or change an existing Draft record/Registered DOI to Findable state).
  * `register` - Create a DOI in [Registered state](https://support.datacite.org/docs/doi-states#registered-doi-name) (or change an existing Draft record to Registered state).
  * `hide` - Change a DOI from Findable to Registered state.

identifiers.description: Equivalent to the [AlternateIdentifier](https://datacite-metadata-schema.readthedocs.io/en/4/properties/alternateidentifier/) property in the DataCite Metadata Schema. For more information, see [What is the "identifiers" attribute in the REST API?](https://support.datacite.org/docs/what-is-the-identifiers-attribute-in-the-rest-api)

affiliation.description: Set `affiliation=true` to see additional affiliation information such as the affiliation identifier.

publisher.description: [DataCite Metadata Schema: Publisher](https://datacite-metadata-schema.readthedocs.io/en/4/properties/publisher/) Set `publisher=true` to see additional publisher information such as the publisher identifier.

affiliation.description: Set `affiliation=true` to see additional affiliation information such as the affiliation identifier.

url.description: The landing page URL of the DOI.

contentUrl.description: An array of content URLs associated with the DOI.

metadataVersion.description: The version of the stored DataCite metadata, incremented once per update.

schemaVersion.description: The DataCite Metadata Schema version of the stored DOI metadata represented as a URL. When creating or updating a DOI, `schemaVersion` is not necessary unless modifying the DataCite Metadata Schema version.

allOf.description: The system used to create the DOI.

isActive.description: "true" if the DOI is in [Findable state](https://support.datacite.org/docs/doi-states#findable-doi-name). Otherwise, "false".

allOf.description: The [state of the DOI](https://support.datacite.org/docs/doi-states).
